column4: k i just switched to ubuntu 8.04 from gentoo, in gentoo i had rc-update for modifying runlevels, is there an ubuntu equivalent?
apt-cache search runlevel ... update-rc.d is popular.
Remember, on Debian/Ubuntu 2-5 are the same thing by default.
Same one you used in Gentoo... apt-cache search <whatever-you-used-in-gentoo> ... it'll be in Ubuntu, I'd bet  :)
